Instrument.name: Lunar Trailblazer Spacecraft High Resolution Volatiles and Minerals Moon Mapper
Instrument.description: The Lunar Trailblazer (LT) Spacecraft High Resolution Volatiles and Minerals Moon Mapper (HVM3) is a shortwave infrared (SWIR) imaging spectrometer designed to identify and quantify water on the lunar surface. The spatial resolution of the instrument is 70 m/pixel over 20 km width, and the spectral resolution is 10 nm over 0.6 to 3.6 Î¼m. The HVM3 consists of a telescope, focal plane array, and imaging spectrometer. The HVM3 will be able to identify bound water, water ice, and hydroxyl, as well as many other compounds (e.g., CO2, CH3, NH3).
